pestManagement.CRITICAL_DISEASE: Bacterial wilt (Ralstonia solanacearum) - FATAL, NO CURE
prevention: Use ONLY certified disease-free seed rhizomes
NEVER plant in soil - use soilless media ONLY
Ensure EXCELLENT drainage - waterlogged soil spreads disease
NEVER plant downslope from infected fields
If disease appears: REMOVE and BURN affected plants immediately

actions: Improve drainage NOW before season starts
Reduce watering - let rain do the work
Avoid working in fields when wet (spreads disease)

solutions: Raised beds: Minimum 12 inches high for ginger/turmeric
Contour planting: Follow land contours to slow water flow
Drainage ditches: Dig swales every 20-30 feet
Gravel base: Add 2-4 inches drainage layer under grow bags
Slope management: Plant on slight slope (2-5%) for natural drainage
Avoid low spots: Never plant in areas where water pools
highRainfall.monitoring: Check drainage after heavy rain - water should drain within 24 hours
